ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Business Services Organisation, Procurement and Logistics Service

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: Business Services Organisation, Procurement and Logistics Service

SHORT_DESCR.P: This notice relates to the purchase of disposable Polythene aprons for use across Health and Social Care in Northern Ireland.

This notice relates to the purchase of aprons. These aprons were procured without competition under Regulation 32(2)(c) of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015. The rationale for procuring these items under Regualtion 32(2)(c) is as follows:

1) The item(s) was required to assist the contracting authority to respond to the impact of COVID-19 immediately, addressing the potential public health risks and disruption to services which would have been incurred without the item;
2) The contracting authority could not have planned or preempted the current COVID-19 situation nor the impact on demand for this item(s);

3) A procurement exercise to establish a new contractual arrangement would not be feasible given the time constraints, making it impossible to undertake a new procurement exercise or to access other commercial agreements (e.g. frameworks);
4) The COVID-19 is not a situation which can be attributed to the actions of the contracting authority.

INFO_ADD.P: The value stated at Section II.1.7 is the maximum value attributed to this direct award contract.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: The rationale for procuring these items under Regualtion 32(2)(c) is as follows:

1) The item(s) was required to assist the contracting authority to respond to the impact of COVID-19 immediately, addressing the potential public health risks and disruption to services which would have been incurred without the item;
2) The contracting authority could not have planned or preempted the current COVID-19 situation nor the impact on demand for this item(s);

3) A procurement exercise to establish a new contractual arrangement would not be feasible given the time constraints, making it impossible to undertake a new procurement exercise or to access other commercial agreements (e.g. frameworks);
4) The COVID-19 is not a situation which can be attributed to the actions of the contracting authority.
